description: The root model. A model of all models. Your home.

hierarchy.description: Nodes can contain sub-BAMs. Zoom in for detail, zoom out for overview.

Reality.description: A project/system with its own BAM model. The spawn point for agents entering this world.

agent_context_spec._note: Every Reality SHOULD have an agent_context. This is the spawn point.

Subsystem.description: A major component of a reality, can contain its own sub-BAM

Aspiration.description: A goal - human controlled, immutable by AI

Gap.description: An explicit delta between aspiration and reality. The work to be done.

Todo.description: A specific action that closes part of a gap

UIState.description: UI state stored in the model. Renderers read and write this node to change what the user sees.

View.description: A declarative UI view definition. A renderer materializes this into an on-screen layout.

Query.description: A declarative graph query over nodes/edges used by views. Kept intentionally small; evaluated by a renderer.

Action.description: A declarative mutation the renderer can apply to the model (allowlisted). Used for interaction bindings.

Proof.description: A structured record that a described reality and its implemented artifacts are aligned. Proof is stored in the model as data.

Audit.description: An actionable integrity check over the model. Audits are meant to be runnable procedures whose results can be recorded back into the model.

Check.description: A smaller, focused check (often part of an Audit).

Policy.description: A governing rule for how changes are proposed, executed, and accepted. Policies are enforced via audits/checks and agent_context principles.

Change.description: A proposed or executed change, explicitly tied to aspirations (why) and gaps (what delta), with required evidence.

TARGETS.description: Reality is working towards another (long-term goal)

DERIVES_FROM.description: Aspiration derives from a more fundamental aspiration

BLOCKS.description: Gap blocks achievement of an aspiration

CLOSES.description: Todo closes (part of) a gap when completed

AUDITS.description: Audit targets a subject (usually a Reality or Subsystem)

GOVERNS.description: Policy governs the work (changes and/or todos).

ADDRESSES.description: A Change addresses a Gap (the explicit delta it reduces).

ADVANCES.description: A Change advances an Aspiration (the explicit why).

PRODUCES.description: A Change produces evidence artifacts (Proof/Audit/Check) recorded in the model.

nodes.label: Spawnie
nodes.description: Workflow orchestrator for CLI agents. First system fully embracing the Root philosophy.

agent_context._note: This is a portal node. Prefer spawning into Spawnie by loading its referenced model and using its internal Reality spawn point.

work_queue.why: Make Spawnie instantly understandable from Root without loading another file
work_queue.exit_criteria: Root embeds a meaningful Spawnie summary and/or key nodes

nodes.label: Root
nodes.description: The Root meta-model. A model of all models. Your home. This node is self-referential - the Root models itself.

agent_context._spawn_point: YOU ARE HERE. This is Root - the root of all models.
agent_context.philosophy: Don't train the agent, train the world. You are waking up in a modeled world where everything is known. Read the model, understand it, work through it.

work_queue.why: Enforce model-only work so the model becomes the interface
work_queue.exit_criteria: The workflow is documented in the model and adopted as standard

work_queue.why: Make model edits safe + auditable by routing them through a controlled executor
work_queue.exit_criteria: A spawned change executor applies Change nodes via the Root Store gate and only commits when audits are green

work_queue.why: Enforce that all changes explicitly advance aspirations by closing gaps
work_queue.exit_criteria: Change/Policy/Audit pattern is in place and used for all work

work_queue.why: Stop repeatedly reading many JSON files by creating a fast query layer with safe writes and enforcement
work_queue.exit_criteria: Model Store indexes the model into SQLite, serves queries, applies Changes with validation, and records audit evidence back into the model

work_queue.why: Make reality verifiable by hash (drift detection)
work_queue.exit_criteria: All core Root files (under C:/seed) referenced by the model include verified SHA256 hashes

work_queue.why: Dogfood monitoring: Root should be a first-class monitored reality
work_queue.exit_criteria: Root appears in its own monitor with meaningful status

principles: Default: do not directly edit files. Prefer activating modeled Actions and proposing Changes.
Interactive agents SHOULD be activate-only: request a spawned change executor for edits.
Moves are bundle-closure operations: respect node.mobility and move attached nodes together (Audit<->Check via HAS_CHECK, parent/child via CONTAINS).
Do not manually cut/paste nodes across files; use root_store.move_nodes_to_file and verify audit-root-store-attachment-closure.
Every change MUST be represented as a Change node that (a) ADDRESSES a Gap and (b) ADVANCES at least one Aspiration, with required evidence recorded back into the model
Gaps are explicit - find them in nodes with type=Gap
Todos CLOSE gaps - that's their purpose
Aspirations are human-controlled, immutable by AI
When in doubt, make the implicit explicit in the model

how_to_work.1_orient: Find this agent_context in the Reality node. You are here.
how_to_work.2_understand: Read focus gap. Read aspirations it blocks. Understand the delta.
how_to_work.3_act: Pick highest priority todo from work_queue that CLOSES the focus gap.
how_to_work.4_update: After work, update model: mark todos done, update gap status, add discoveries.
how_to_work.5_verify: Model must reflect truth. If you changed anything, model must show it.

model._note: This is a self-reference. Root contains its own model.

nodes.label: Root Model Store
nodes.description: Local-first model backend: a uniform interface over many model locations (multiple JSON files, submodels, and eventually many repos/worlds). Maintains a derived SQLite index/cache for fast query/search/reverse lookups, records provenance for writeback, and provides safe writes with governance enforcement (Change gate, validation, audits, and model-recorded evidence).

agent_context._note: The SQLite DB is derived state and must be reproducible from the model JSON files.

work_queue.why: Enable fast query + safe writes + enforcement for Root
work_queue.exit_criteria: Store can load root model + refs, index into SQLite, answer queries, apply Change patches with validation, and run/record audits

work_queue.why: Make the store a stable interface over many model locations
work_queue.exit_criteria: A Model Registry reality exists and is referenced by the store; models can be discovered without knowing file paths

work_queue.why: Enable moving most content out of seed/model/sketch.json safely
work_queue.exit_criteria: Audit/check evidence and Change application write back to the correct provenance file, not only the root entry file

recommendations: If reality sources matter for this node, commit/stash changes before verification
If reality sources matter for this node, commit/stash changes before verification

nodes.label: Model Registry
nodes.description: A registry of model locations (local paths, repos, URLs) that the Root Model Store can index into one logical graph. This is the backbone for a world where Seed is only one of many referenced nodes.

agent_context._note: Backbone node: once this exists, most users should not need to know file paths to find worlds.

work_queue.why: Turn distributed model locations into a discoverable graph
work_queue.exit_criteria: Registry captures at least local-file locations and can be indexed by the store

nodes.label: Store
nodes.description: Core model store components: loader/merger, SQLite index, query engine, safe writer, enforcement, watcher, audit runner, API.

save.notes: Node-defined save behavior. Spawnie workflow seed-save-node should interpret this if present; otherwise fall back to a default save routine.

recommendations: If reality sources matter for this node, commit/stash changes before verification
If reality sources matter for this node, commit/stash changes before verification

results.stdout:
+---------------------------------------------------------+
| Saved subsystem-root-store                              |
| Chain: subsystem-root-store -> reality-root-model-store |
| Preflight: ok                                           |
| Preflight warnings: 1 (e.g., git working tree is dirty) |
| Rough checks: attachment_closure, root_store_index      |
+---------------------------------------------------------+
Wrote C:\seed\output\root_state.txt

nodes.label: loader
nodes.description: Loads root model and resolves hierarchical _ref submodels into a single logical graph with provenance.

nodes.label: sqlite-index
nodes.description: Maintains derived SQLite tables for nodes/edges/types/relationships and reverse lookups; supports rebuild from JSON.

nodes.label: query
nodes.description: Query engine (e.g., seedql-v0) backed by SQLite; returns results with provenance (where-defined mapping).

nodes.label: writer
nodes.description: Safe writes: applies Changes as deterministic patches back to the correct JSON file(s), with locking and validation.

nodes.label: enforcement
nodes.description: Governance enforcement: Change gate, schema/edge validation, policy checks, and automatic audit execution.

nodes.label: audits
nodes.description: Runs modeled audits/checks and records results back into the model as structured evidence.

nodes.label: watcher
nodes.description: Watches model JSON files for changes, invalidates/rebuilds index, and emits events/subscriptions for UI/agents.

nodes.label: api
nodes.description: Local API (HTTP or IPC) for query/subscribe/apply_change/run_audit.

nodes.label: translate
nodes.description: Human-facing translation layer: renders the model state as plain English and writes a snapshot file for users.

nodes.label: integration
nodes.description: Integration queue primitives: implements the verbal save command (enqueue integration for a node, run rough checks, propagate to parents).

nodes.label: Verbal Save
nodes.description: A conversational cue ("let's save") that triggers integration for the current node: write summary/evidence, run rough checks, and propagate handoff to parents (turtles all the way up).

nodes.label: Node Reality Sync State
nodes.description:
A per-node, model-recorded notion of synchronization/alignment with underlying reality.

Convention (v0): when action-save-node runs, it writes evidence.integration_queue.last_attempt (always) and evidence.integration_queue.last_save (only if preflight passes).

Preflight captures:
- git cleanliness (dirty / clean)
- upstream freshness when available (behind / ahead)
- local neighborhood scan (edges + adjacent nodes) to force a surrounding-area evaluation before declaring a save.

This keeps "interrupts" inside the model: agents can query for nodes whose last_attempt.preflight.ok is false, or whose rough checks failed, and treat them as "reality may have changed" / "needs pull".

nodes.label: Root Store: SQLite Schema v0
nodes.description:
Derived SQLite index (rebuildable from JSON). Tables (v0):

- meta(key TEXT PRIMARY KEY, value TEXT)
- nodes(id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, type TEXT, label TEXT, description TEXT, json TEXT, provenance_file TEXT)
- edges(id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, type TEXT, from_id TEXT, to_id TEXT, json TEXT, provenance_file TEXT)
- node_text(id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, text TEXT)  -- optional denormalized search

Indices (v0):
- nodes_type_idx ON nodes(type)
- edges_from_idx ON edges(from_id)
- edges_to_idx ON edges(to_id)
- edges_type_idx ON edges(type)

Provenance contract (v0): provenance_file is the model JSON file that defined the row; for _ref loaded models, provenance_file is that referenced file path.

nodes.label: Open Root UI Dashboard
nodes.description: Navigate to the Root UI model and open its dashboard view.

nodes.label: Request Change Executor Spawn
nodes.description: Request a spawned change executor that applies a Change via the Root Store gate and only commits if audits are green.

target.prompt_template: You are a change executor. You DO make edits, but only by implementing an explicit Change node and keeping Root audits green. Inputs: change_id={{change_id}}. Workflow: 1) Create a git branch, 2) Apply required file/model edits, 3) Run unit/integration checks as appropriate, 4) Run Root audits (at minimum: audit-root-store-index-consistency and audit-root-compliance), 5) Only commit if audits PASS, otherwise report failures and do not commit. Record structured evidence back into the model where appropriate.

nodes.label: Save (Integration Queue)
nodes.description: Model-driven save: triggers the Spawnie workflow 'seed-save-node'. The workflow receives node_id and runs the node-defined save behavior.

target.command_template: spawnie workflows run seed-save-node --input node_id={{node_id}} --input root_model_path=C:/seed/model/sketch.json

nodes.label: UI
nodes.description: Entry point into the model-driven UI world. This view exists in the root so agents can always find the UI quickly.

links.title: Request Change Executor
links.notes: Provide a Change id; executor commits only if audits PASS.

links.title: Save a Node (Integration Queue)
links.notes: Use when you say 'let's save'. Input: node_id (the node you're working on).

nodes.label: Core
nodes.description: Root's core implementation - pulse, status, monitoring, verification

nodes.label: UI
nodes.description: Root's UI subsystem (model-driven visualization + renderer). This is the primary navigation mountpoint for UI work; the UI model lives where the UI should materialize: C:/seed/ui/model/sketch.json.

nodes.label: BAM
nodes.description: Tool for generating models of complex systems

agent_context._note: BAM is not yet fully modeled here; this is a minimal spawn point for future work.

work_queue.why: Build the BAM tool so BAMs can be created/maintained
work_queue.exit_criteria: BAM tool exists and is itself modeled with proofs

nodes.label: BAM Test Projects
nodes.description: Smaller projects to validate the model-as-workspace concept.

agent_context._note: Minimal spawn point to create and model test projects.

work_queue.why: Validate BAM + modeling workflows on small projects
work_queue.exit_criteria: Multiple test projects are modeled and used regularly

nodes.label: 4. REALITY: Browser Renderer
nodes.description: A browser-based renderer that watches the Root model and renders declarative views as an interactive graph. Polls the model for changes and updates visualization in real-time. Your screen IS this reality - model changes become visual truth.

agent_context._note: The renderer IS the screen. Claude modifies model Ã¢â€ â€™ screen updates. This is the real-time visualization reality.

work_queue.why: Full loop: modelÃ¢â€ â€™screenÃ¢â€ â€™interactionÃ¢â€ â€™model
work_queue.exit_criteria: User clicks on screen Ã¢â€ â€™ model updates Ã¢â€ â€™ screen reflects change

mod-ui-renderer.label: Renderer (index.html)
mod-ui-renderer.description: Browser-based graph visualization using vis.js. Polls model JSON, renders nodes/edges as interactive graph, shows node details on click.

mod-ui-server.label: Dev Server (server.py)
mod-ui-server.description: Simple HTTP server for local development. Serves model JSON with CORS headers. Port 8420.

mod-ui-screenshot.label: Screenshot Tool (screenshot.py)
mod-ui-screenshot.description: Captures user's screen so Claude can see what they see. The feedback loop: user's reality becomes Claude's input. Run with 'python ui/screenshot.py' to save screenshot.png.

action-capture-screenshot.label: Capture Screenshot
action-capture-screenshot.description: Claude captures the user's screen to see their reality. Saves to ui/screenshot.png which Claude can then read.

recommendations: If reality sources matter for this node, commit/stash changes before verification
If reality sources matter for this node, commit/stash changes before verification

nodes.label: Proof: Root Reality Alignment
nodes.description: Stub proof record for Root itself. To be completed as hashes and checks are added.

scope.notes: Primary requirement: model is internally consistent and all referenced artifacts are hash-verified.

expected: Hash checks recorded for seed-referenced source files
A machine-readable verification result stored in the model

nodes.label: Proof: Root UI Reality Alignment
nodes.description: Proof record for the browser renderer reality. Demonstrates model-driven visualization.

implemented: Renderer loads model JSON via HTTP fetch
Renderer polls model every 1 second for changes
UI updates automatically when model JSON changes
pending: Bidirectional sync (user interaction Ã¢â€ â€™ model update)

nodes.label: Audit: Root Model Consistency
nodes.description: Check internal integrity of the Root model: schema/types, edge endpoints, gap/todo wiring, and cross-model references.

scope.notes: This audit is intended to become runnable (with scripts) and record structured findings back into the model.

findings.last_summary: PASS: 0 errors, 0 warnings (schema/types, edges, gap/todo wiring, refs)

nodes.label: Policy: Aspiration-Aligned Change
nodes.description: Enforce that all changes move the system closer to its aspirations: changes must be explicit, gap-tied, aspiration-tied, and evidenced.
rules: No work is accepted without a Change node.
Each Change MUST ADDRESSES at least one Gap and ADVANCES at least one Aspiration.
Each Change MUST define expected_delta and evidence_required.
Evidence MUST be recorded back into the model as Proof/Audit/Check nodes (not just terminal output).

nodes.label: Policy: Activate-Only Interactive Agents
nodes.description: Interactive agents must not directly edit model files. They may read the model and activate modeled Actions. Any edits are performed by a spawned change executor that applies a Change via the Root Store gate and only commits when audits are green.
rules: Interactive agents MUST NOT directly edit model JSON files.
Interactive agents MAY propose a Change and activate action-request-change-executor.
Interactive agents MAY activate action-save-node to record integration evidence via the Root Store (no direct file edits).
Edits MUST be applied through the Root Store change gate (writer.apply_change + enforcement).
The change executor MUST run required audits/checks and only commit if all are PASS.

nodes.label: Policy: Bundle-Closure Moves
nodes.description: When nodes are moved across model files, attached nodes must move with them as one closure (prevents partial moves and orphaned attachments).
rules: Treat moves as bundle operations, not individual node cut/paste.
Respect node.mobility: attached nodes must not be moved alone; bundle roots move their attachment closure.
Use root_store.move_nodes_to_file for moves that cross files.
After any move, verify audit-root-store-attachment-closure is PASS (screams on partial moves).

nodes.label: Policy: Save Preflight (Sync + Neighborhood)
nodes.description: Saving updates the model (the truth). Preflight is required to be recorded so agents can judge freshness/surrounding context, but it must not block model evolution. Strictness belongs in reality verification audits.
rules: action-save-node MUST record a preflight payload in evidence.integration_queue.last_save.preflight.
Preflight MUST include a neighborhood scan (radius >= 1) and record it in evidence so later agents can see what was considered.
Preflight MUST include a neighborhood scan (radius >= 1) and record it in evidence so later agents can see what was considered.
Agents SHOULD fetch/pull latest reality (git) before running reality verification when an upstream exists.

nodes.label: Audit: Change Alignment
nodes.description: Audit that all Change nodes are aspiration-aligned: each Change addresses a Gap, advances an Aspiration, and records evidence.

findings.last_summary: PASS: all Change nodes have ADDRESSES/ADVANCES/PRODUCES (or evidence)

evidence.ran_with: Root model integrity snippet (includes change alignment checks)

nodes.label: Check: Change Has Gap
nodes.description: Every Change must ADDRESSES at least one Gap.

nodes.label: Check: Change Has Aspiration
nodes.description: Every Change must ADVANCES at least one Aspiration.

nodes.label: Check: Change Has Evidence
nodes.description: Every Change must PRODUCES at least one Proof/Audit/Check or include structured evidence fields.

nodes.label: Audit: Change Executor Gate
nodes.description: Verify that changes were applied through the change executor workflow: branch, apply_change, verification, Root audits, and commit gating.

notes: This audit becomes enforceable once the change executor exists.
PASS means recent commits that touch model files include evidence of change-executor pipeline and Root audits passing.

nodes.label: Check: Executor Uses Root Store Gate
nodes.description: The change executor applies modifications via Root Store writer/enforcement (apply_change) rather than ad-hoc edits.

nodes.label: Check: Executor Runs Root Audits
nodes.description: The change executor runs Root audits (at minimum: audit-root-store-index-consistency and audit-root-compliance) before commit.

nodes.label: Check: Commit Only When Green
nodes.description: The change executor only commits when required audits/checks are PASS (green).

nodes.label: Audit: Store Distributed-Model Backbone
nodes.description: Ensure the Root Model Store acts as a stable interface over multiple model locations: registry exists, provenance-aware writeback exists, and multi-root loading is supported.

nodes.label: Audit: Root Compliance (Seed Ideas)
nodes.description: Agent-style audit that assesses how completely each top Reality follows the Root/Seed ideas. This evolves over time: it should run the current automated checks, then extend into deeper behavioral/system probing.

notes: Must include the existing sqlite index rebuild/compare audit as a sub-check.
Must report per-Reality completeness, and list concrete missing items.
On FAIL, should emit a scream packet suitable for an interactive Spawnie shell session.

scream.suggested_spawnie_shell: spawnie shell --new-window --working-dir C:/seed --model claude-sonnet "A Root model audit failed. You are an interactive debug agent.  Open and read this scream packet JSON (it contains the Root top node and failure evidence): - C:/seed/root_store/screams/20260201_130340Z-audit-root-compliance.json  Goals: 1) Explain why the check failed (root cause). 2) Propose the smallest Change (model-level) or code fix (reality-level) to resolve it. 3) If a fix is code, list exact file edits; if a fix is model, list exact node/edge edits. 4) Define how we re-run the audit and what PASS evidence looks like."

nodes.label: Check: Agent Context Completeness
nodes.description: Top Reality nodes have complete agent_context (spawn point, focus, work_queue) consistent with the Root contract.

nodes.label: Check: Hash-Control Coverage
nodes.description: Implementation module nodes have source.hash and the hashes verify against reality; missing/changed hashes are treated as uncontrolled drift.

nodes.label: Check: Change Governance Adoption
nodes.description: Changes are governed: Policy/Change/Audit wiring exists and is used (Change gate is real, not just declared).

nodes.label: Check: Audits Are Runnable
nodes.description: Modeled audits can be executed and write structured evidence back into the model.

nodes.label: Check: Store Has Model Registry
nodes.description: The store references a Model Registry reality so model locations are discoverable without hardcoding file paths.

nodes.label: Check: Provenance-Aware Writeback
nodes.description: Audits/checks and Change application write back to the correct provenance file for each node/edge (not only the root entry model file).

nodes.label: Check: Multi-Root Loading
nodes.description: The store can load multiple root entry models (not just a single root + its refs) into one logical graph.

nodes.label: Change: Aspiration-Aligned Change Process v1
nodes.description: Introduce and adopt the Change/Policy/Audit pattern so future work is guaranteed to move toward aspirations.
evidence_required: audit-change-alignment exists and is linked to checks
All new work is represented as Change nodes tied to gaps/aspirations

nodes.label: Change: Root Model Store (v1)
nodes.description: Build a local-first Model Store that indexes Root into SQLite for fast queries and provides safe writes with governance enforcement.

nodes.label: Change: Store Distributed-Model Backbone (v1)
nodes.description: Evolve the Root Model Store into the backbone interface over many model locations: model registry, multi-root loading, and provenance-aware writeback so large models can live in many files.

nodes.label: Change: Change Executor Workflow (v1)
nodes.description: Define and adopt a spawned change executor workflow: interactive agents are activate-only; edits happen via a change executor that runs audits and only commits when green.

nodes.label: Reality is Part of the Model
nodes.description: Models embed reality via source references with hashes. Drift is detected automatically.

nodes.label: Intent vs Reality
nodes.description: Nodes without source = goals. Nodes with source = current state. Delta = work to do.

nodes.label: Self-Containing Models
nodes.description: Each reality contains its own model. The model lives inside what it describes.

nodes.label: Model as Workspace
nodes.description: Everyone on the project works through the model. It's not documentation - it's the interface to reality.

nodes.label: Distributed Model (Many Locations)
nodes.description: A single logical model graph can live across many files and many repos. Stable IDs + provenance make the physical location an implementation detail. The store provides the interface.

nodes.label: Provenance-Aware Writeback
nodes.description: When a node/edge is updated (audit evidence, todo status, Change application), the system writes back to the file that originally defined it. This is required to keep seed/model/sketch.json thin over time.

nodes.label: Hierarchical BAMs
nodes.description: Nodes can contain sub-BAMs. Zoom in for detail, zoom out for overview. Fractal structure.

nodes.label: Pulse-Based Health Monitoring
nodes.description: Active health monitoring via heartbeats. Traditional process monitoring tells you IF a process exists. Pulse tells you HOW WELL it's running. Processes send pulses at intervals; monitors track timing and detect degradation before failure.

nodes.label: Train the World, Not the Agent
nodes.description: The paradigm shift: instead of making agents smarter at navigating messy reality, make reality (the model) complete enough that navigation is trivial. An agent in a well-modeled world needs no training - it simply reads and understands.

nodes.label: The Model IS the World
nodes.description: The model is not a map of reality - it is reality. When you change the model, you change the world. When reality drifts from the model, reality is wrong, not the model.

nodes.label: Model-Driven UI
nodes.description: The screen is a projection of the model. A renderer watches the model and updates the UI based solely on model nodes (views, queries, actions). Agents change what you see by editing the model, not by editing UI code.

nodes.label: Proof of Alignment
nodes.description: Any implemented reality must be provably aligned to the model: (1) the model's described reality is internally consistent, and (2) the actual files match the model via verified hashes and checks.

nodes.label: Proof Protocol (Model-Recorded)
nodes.description: Proof is a node in the model. A Proof records subject, method, status, and evidence. Preferred methods: schema-validate, hash-verify, and acceptance checks. Evidence should be machine-readable and stored in the model (or referenced by content-hash), not as ephemeral console output.

nodes.label: Reality Node as Spawn Point
nodes.description: Every model has a Reality node that serves as the agent's spawn point. The Reality node contains an agent_context property with: focus (current gap), work_queue (prioritized todos), principles (how to work), and how_to_work (step by step). An agent entering any model looks for the Reality node and reads its agent_context. This is the pattern for all models.

nodes.label: 5. CONCEPT: Screen IS Model
nodes.description: What you see on screen is a direct projection of the model. Claude edits the model, and within 1 second your screen updates. This node appeared because Claude added it to the model. The equilibrium: model Ã¢â€ â€™ screen Ã¢â€ â€™ interaction Ã¢â€ â€™ model. This is the live connection.

nodes.label: Claude Sees Your Screen
nodes.description: Via screenshot.py, Claude can capture and view the user's screen. This closes the feedback loop: user sees model projections, Claude sees user's reality. Both directions of the equilibrium are now visible.

nodes.label: The Seed Philosophy
nodes.description: Don't train your agent, train your world. Instead of building smarter agents that navigate chaos, build complete worlds (models) where everything is instantly known, understood, and workable. The transformation: from 'agent discovers files' to 'agent wakes up in a world'. This is the root aspiration.

nodes.label: Instant Context
nodes.description: An agent reading the model should instantly understand everything - structure, relationships, intent, state. No discovery phase. No file searching. No exploration. The model IS the understanding.

nodes.label: Model Contains Reality
nodes.description: The model doesn't describe reality - it contains it. Source references with hashes embed actual artifacts. The model is not documentation of the world, it IS the world.

nodes.label: Model Everything
nodes.description: All systems the user works with should be modeled in seed. Every project, every tool, every workflow. The model is the universal interface to all realities.

nodes.label: Regenerable Reality
nodes.description: If the model is complete enough, physical artifacts become disposable projections. Delete the code, regenerate from model. The model is the source, reality is the render.

nodes.label: Single Source of Truth
nodes.description: The model is THE truth. Not a reflection of truth, not documentation of truth - the actual truth. All changes flow through the model. Reality follows.

nodes.label: Aspiration-Aligned Change
nodes.description: Every accepted change demonstrably moves the system closer to one or more aspirations by reducing explicit gaps, with evidence recorded in the model.

nodes.label: 1. ASPIRATION: Model-Driven Visualization
nodes.description: A browser-based UI renders directly from the model (and referenced sub-models). Changing the model changes what is displayed on screen, without manual UI configuration. Interaction is modeled as actions that mutate the model. Long-term: the model contains a self-describing interface for navigation, status, drift, and work queues.

nodes.label: Model Does Not Yet Contain All Reality
nodes.description: The Root model exists but doesn't fully contain reality. Source files lack hashes. Some artifacts aren't modeled. An agent reading this model doesn't yet have instant context.
nodes.current_state: Model has structure but incomplete source references. No hashes on Root Core modules. Spawnie model is referenced but not embedded.
nodes.target_state: Every source file has a node with verified hash. Agent reads model and knows everything without file discovery.

nodes.label: Model-First Workflow Not Yet Enforced
nodes.description: Work can still happen outside the model. Files can be edited directly. The model should be the ONLY interface.
nodes.current_state: Model exists alongside reality. Both can be edited independently. Drift can occur.
nodes.target_state: All work flows through the model. Reality is generated/updated from model. Direct file edits are detected as drift.

nodes.label: No Change Executor Workflow
nodes.description: There is no controlled change executor that applies changes via the Root Store gate and commits only if audits are green. Interactive agents and humans can still make uncontrolled edits.
nodes.current_state: Edits can be applied directly to files. Audits may run, but nothing enforces a commit gate.
nodes.target_state: Edits flow through a spawned change executor that applies Change nodes via the Root Store gate, runs required audits, and only commits when all are PASS.

nodes.label: No Root Model Store Yet
nodes.description: Working with many JSON models is slow and repetitive without a single query/write surface. There is no central Model Store that can index into SQLite, answer queries fast, and apply Changes with validation and audits.
nodes.current_state: Tools read JSON files directly and rebuild in-memory indexes ad hoc. Writes are manual edits without a consistent change gate. Audits/checks are not centrally runnable.
nodes.target_state: A Model Store maintains a derived SQLite index/cache, answers queries with provenance, applies Changes as safe writes with governance enforcement, and records audit evidence back into the model.

nodes.label: No Model Registry
nodes.description: Model locations are not yet discoverable as part of the world. Users and tools still need to know file paths and entrypoints.
nodes.current_state: The store can follow _ref links from a single root entry model, but there is no explicit registry of model roots/locations.
nodes.target_state: A Model Registry reality exists that enumerates model roots/locations, enabling the store to build a unified graph across many worlds.

nodes.label: No Provenance-Aware Writeback
nodes.description: Audit evidence and automated updates cannot safely target the file where a node/edge is defined, blocking moving most content out of the root entry model.
nodes.current_state: Writeback behavior is not guaranteed for nodes defined in referenced models; this makes distributed models risky.
nodes.target_state: All model mutations (audits/checks/changes) write to the correct provenance file deterministically.

nodes.label: Changes Not Explicitly Aspiration-Aligned
nodes.description: Changes can be made without explicitly stating which aspiration they advance and which gap they reduce, so progress toward aspirations is not enforced.
nodes.current_state: Work is tracked as todos/gaps, but there is no mandatory change proposal/acceptance gate tying each change to aspirations with evidence.
nodes.target_state: All work is represented as Change nodes that address explicit gaps, advance explicit aspirations, and produce model-recorded evidence. Audits enforce the policy.

nodes.label: Root Does Not Fully Monitor Itself
nodes.description: Root should appear in its own monitor. The pulse should check Root. Currently Root monitors others but not itself completely.
nodes.current_state: Root is modeled as reality-seed node. But Root Core modules lack source hashes. Self-monitoring may not include Root itself.
nodes.target_state: Root appears in its own monitor with green/yellow/red status. All Root modules have verified hashes. Root is a first-class reality it monitors.

nodes.label: 2. GAP: No UI Yet
nodes.description: Browser renderer exists and shows model as interactive graph. Model changes appear on screen in real-time. Remaining: bidirectional sync (user interaction Ã¢â€ â€™ model update) and full UIState integration.
nodes.current_state: Renderer (ui/index.html) polls model JSON and visualizes nodes/edges as interactive graph. Model edits by Claude appear on screen within 1 second. Node details shown on click.
nodes.target_state: Full bidirectional sync: modelÃ¢â€ â€™screen (done) AND screenÃ¢â€ â€™model (pending). UIState drives view selection. User interactions write back to model.

remaining: User interaction Ã¢â€ â€™ model writeback

nodes.label: No Proof Recorded For Realities
nodes.description: Realities can be described (and even implemented) without an explicit proof record tying the model to the file artifacts.
nodes.current_state: There is no enforced proof node pattern; verification outputs are not recorded as structured model data.
nodes.target_state: Each implemented reality has at least one Proof node with machine-readable evidence showing schema validity and hash alignment between model and files.

nodes.label: BAM Tool Not Yet Built
nodes.description: The BAM tool (generator/manager for models) is not yet implemented as a modeled, usable reality.
nodes.current_state: BAM is modeled as a reality (no-model-yet) but lacks a working tool + model integration.
nodes.target_state: BAM tool exists, can generate/maintain BAMs, and is itself modeled with proofs.

nodes.label: No BAM Test Projects
nodes.description: There are no small, modeled test projects to validate BAM and the model-as-workspace concept end-to-end.
nodes.current_state: Test project reality exists only as an idea; no concrete test suite of projects is modeled and validated.
nodes.target_state: Multiple small projects are modeled and used to validate modeling workflows and tooling.

nodes.label: Model Execution Layer Missing
nodes.description: The model cannot yet represent execution triggers, events, and state as first-class data.
nodes.current_state: The model describes work and structure, but execution state/events are not modeled.
nodes.target_state: Execution triggers, events, and state are modeled; workers can run actions and record results as model data.

nodes.label: Root Core Tests Not Verified
nodes.description: Root Core tests exist but have not been explicitly verified/recorded as evidence in the model.
nodes.current_state: Tests may pass/fail, but there is no structured, recorded evidence of verification.
nodes.target_state: Tests are verified when requested and results are recorded as proof/evidence in the model.

nodes.label: Reality Lifecycle Not Managed
nodes.description: Root does not yet provide modeled start/stop/restart lifecycle management for realities.
nodes.target_state: Lifecycle is modeled (actions/events/state) and can be driven from the model/UI.

nodes.label: Build BAM Tool
nodes.description: Create the BAM tool for generating and managing models of complex systems

nodes.label: BAM Test Projects
nodes.description: Test the model-as-workspace concept with smaller projects

nodes.label: Model Execution Layer
nodes.description: Add triggers, execution state, and events to the model so execution is also modeled

nodes.label: Adopt Aspiration-Aligned Change Process (v1)
nodes.description: Define and adopt a change gate: every change must be a Change node that addresses a gap and advances an aspiration, with evidence recorded as Proof/Audit/Check nodes.

nodes.label: Build Root Model Store (SQLite + Enforcement)
nodes.description: Implement the Root Model Store: (1) resolve root + _ref hierarchy into a single logical graph with provenance (where-defined mapping), (2) maintain a derived SQLite index for fast query/search/reverse lookups, (3) apply Changes as safe writes with schema/edge validation and policy enforcement, (4) run audits/checks and record results back into the model.

nodes.label: Add Model Registry (v0)
nodes.description: Add a Model Registry reality and use it to enumerate model roots/locations so the store can index many worlds without hardcoded entrypoints.

nodes.label: Enable Provenance-Aware Writeback (v1)
nodes.description: Ensure audits/checks and Changes write back to the file where each node/edge is defined. This is required to move most of seed/model/sketch.json into submodels safely.

nodes.label: Establish Model-Only Workflow
nodes.description: From now on, all work happens through the model. This todo itself is worked on by editing the model. Document this workflow in the model. Make it the standard.

nodes.label: Implement Change Executor Workflow (v1)
nodes.description: Implement the spawned change executor pipeline: branch, apply Change via Root Store, run tests/audits, and commit only if green.

nodes.label: Add Source Hashes to Root Core Modules
nodes.description: Add verified SHA256 hashes to all module nodes in subsystem-core. This enables drift detection and proves model contains reality.

nodes.label: Root Self-Monitoring
nodes.description: Ensure Root appears in its own monitor output. The pulse mechanism should check Root as a reality. Root should see itself.

nodes.label: Add Minimal UI Schema to Model
nodes.description: Add minimal UI primitives to the model (e.g., UIState, View, Query, Action). These are declarative nodes that a renderer can interpret.

nodes.label: 3. TODO: Build Renderer
nodes.description: Add a minimal TBD reality node for the future browser renderer. Keep it tiny: just enough for a worker to implement if/when needed.

evidence.what_was_done: Created browser-based graph renderer (ui/index.html) and dev server (ui/server.py). Renderer polls model JSON, renders nodes/edges with vis.js, shows node details on click. Real-time: model changes appear on screen within 1 second.

nodes.label: Require Proof of Alignment for Implemented Realities
nodes.description: Define what 'proof' means for an implemented reality: model is internally consistent, and files match via hashes/verification output recorded back into the model.

nodes.label: Add Proof Nodes For Key Realities
nodes.description: Add Proof nodes (stubs first, then evidence) for reality-seed and any implemented realities. Keep the format machine-readable.

nodes.label: Embed Spawnie Model Summary
nodes.description: Instead of just referencing spawnie's model, embed a meaningful summary so an agent reading seed's model understands spawnie without loading another file.

nodes.label: Verify Seed Core Tests
nodes.description: Run and verify the existing tests in seed_core/tests/, ensure they pass. This is reality-layer work, do only when explicitly requested.

nodes.label: Reality Lifecycle Management
nodes.description: Add start/stop/restart commands to seed for managing spawnie and other reality processes. Reality-layer work.
